channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023100060
item.description:
Report X-2023100060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: GAITHERSBURG
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE SOUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS ROLLING AROUND IN THE PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS ALSO COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING A BOTTLE OF CRYOPRESERVATION MEDIUM WITH FETAL BOVINE SERUM. THERE ARE DRY ICE PELLETS SURROUNDING THE CONTAINER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX HAS A FRAGILE, FROZEN, STORE UPON ARRIVAL YELLOW STICKER APPLIED.

item.title: Report X-2023090846
item.description:
Report X-2023090846

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: GAITHERSBURG
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGES WAS UNLOADED FROM A FOEREVER BAG AND PUT DOWN THE SLIDE INSIDE SMALL SORT. THE CONTENTS INSIDE STARTED TO LEAK OUT AND A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE SCENE. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SLIDE AND TOOK THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE DMP AND THE PACKAGED WAS PROCESSED. UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE THE CONTENTS WERE FOUND TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report E-2023100239
item.description:
Report E-2023100239

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: Hyattsville
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/23/2023 at 0139 hours a 16 rail car and 1 locomotive derailed in Hyattsville, Maryland at BAA 33.4 milepost at the Baltimore Avenue crossing intersecting Emerson Street. UTLX910325 (residue UN2370 Hexene) and UTLX91084 (residue UN1075 liquefied petroleum gas) derailed on their side with no leaks. 14 closed hopper cars with polyurethane pellets derailed with various orientations and varying levels of leaked pellets. The shipper, Shell Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (report 2023-0923-00020). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, as well as (2) Managers of Hazardous Materials from CSX, were dispatched to the scene to assess the damaged hazardous material tank cars, contain leaked pellets, and remediate a minor fuel release from the derailed locomotive. The crossing at Baltimore Avenue and Emerson Street were closed for approximately 7 days as a result of the derailment.
